Job Research Links

  • AngelList - Platform to look at startups, their VC funding rounds, the founders, or other company information.
  • Mattermark - App to browse through quantified data for startups. If the app is not for, but you're interested in working for a start-up, they run an excellent daily newsletter called Mattermark Daily highlighting the startup news, opinions, and events.
  • Hired - Warning: DBC Staff have told me they aren't good for junior engineers.
  • Lunchcruit - Scope out companies that offer a free lunch, request lunch, and then get lunch at this company while seeing if you're a good fit. Thanks to Stephanie for the link.
  • How I Hustled To Get The Perfect Job. A Tradecraft graduate talks about her meticulous process of finding the first job. Full of little nuggets when you're approaching your job search.

The following list is taken from DBC grad Mai Nguygen's Resources Repo. * AngelList * StackOverflow Job Listings * Hired * Jobsuitors * We Work Remotely * Github Jobs * Underdog.io

Welcome ye all who have found the Post-DBC Resources guide. This section are resources to get you started for your Post-DBC life. We're using the Wiki instead of contributing to the Repository. That way, anyone who joins can make without having to do commits (we're not official here).
